Description: Global stock market crash with DJIA falling 22.6% in one day
Iraq invades Kuwait triggering Gulf War and major supply disruption
Operation Desert Storm launches with coalition forces attacking Iraq
Thai baht collapse triggers regional financial crisis affecting oil demand
OPEC agrees to cut production by 1.7 million bpd to support prices
Terrorist attacks on US leading to economic uncertainty and Afghanistan war
Venezuelan oil workers strike reducing production by 2.5 million bpd
US-led invasion of Iraq begins creating supply uncertainty
Brent crude surpasses $40/barrel for first time due to strong demand
Oil reaches all-time high of $147/barrel before financial crisis
Investment bank failure triggers global financial crisis and recession
Tunisian protests spark regional uprisings affecting Libya and other producers
Japan earthquake and nuclear disaster increases oil demand for power generation
OPEC refuses to cut production despite oversupply leading to price crash
OPEC agrees to first production cut since 2008 (1.2 million bpd)
Saudi-Russia price war during pandemic demand collapse crashes prices
WTI crude futures briefly trade negative due to storage concerns
Russian invasion of Ukraine triggers sanctions and supply concerns
